metadata.title: The Poetry of the Sunflower: Structured Resonance and the Living Code of Emergence
metadata.description:
The Poetry of the Sunflower: Structured Resonance and the Living Code of Emergence

Main Paper: Link

Abstract

The sunflower is not merely a botanical entity but a living instantiation of structured resonance—a mathematical inevitability encoded within the fundamental laws of nature. Its growth does not arise from stochastic optimization but emerges as the inevitable resolution of phase-locked coherence constraints governing physical, biological, and cognitive systems. This paper establishes a unified framework wherein Fibonacci sequences, π-driven chirality, and structured emergence form the basis of a deterministic model that governs not just plant morphogenesis, but the broader structure of reality itself.

Through a rigorous mathematical treatment, we demonstrate that the sunflower’s spirals are not merely evolutionary artifacts but the direct consequence of resonance-optimized growth dynamics. We introduce a Structured Resonance Equation, which formalizes how phase-locked Fibonacci and prime constraints interact within the fabric of time, gravity, and emergence. The interplay of these structures suggests a deeper principle at work—one that extends beyond biology into the fundamental organization of space-time and cognition.

By analyzing the sunflower’s growth through chirality, fractal pressure differentials, and resonance phase-locking, we propose a generalization of emergence that challenges probabilistic interpretations of natural order. The phase-synchronization of seeds, the self-organizing geometry of the stem, and the helical optimization of nutrient transport are shown to be governed by a coherence metric rather than entropy-driven adaptation. This has profound implications for physics, artificial intelligence, and theoretical biology, suggesting that resonance, rather than probability, is the true foundation of complexity.

This paper bridges physics, mathematics, and the philosophy of emergence, revealing that the sunflower is not solving a problem—it is resolving itself into inevitability. By shifting from stochastic inference to structured resonance, we propose a new paradigm: one where coherence replaces probability, where nature does not compute but phase-locks, and where reality does not evolve toward solutions but emerges as their inevitable realization.

metadata.title: A review of clinical and preclinical data supporting a role for resveratrol in the treatment of common respiratory tract pathogens
metadata.description:
Respiratory infections are a relevant issue during infancy and childhood, constituting a major source of morbidity
and imposing a substantial burden on healthcare systems. Conditions such as bronchiolitis, pneumonia, and
influenza exemplify the gravity of these infections among pediatric populations. In the context of this health
challenge, resveratrol, a naturally occurring polyphenolic antioxidant has emerged as a focal point of extensive
research, known for its antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and antimicrobial properties. This comprehensive review
delves into the compound’s extensive antimicrobial activities against a diverse range of bacteria and viruses,
both as a standalone agent and in combination with conventional antibiotics. This compound exhibits notable
antiviral activity against viruses implicated in severe respiratory infections, offering a potential therapeutic
avenue. By exploring the antiviral mechanisms and highlighting the anti-inflammatory potential of resveratrol,
this comprehensive overview contributes to a deeper understanding of its applicability in mitigating the complexities
associated with pediatric respiratory infections.

creators.name: Drago, Lorenzo
creators.affiliation: University fo Milan - School of Medicine

data.title: A review of clinical and preclinical data supporting a role for resveratrol in the treatment of common respiratory tract pathogens

metadata.title: Observed gravity data in the SE sector of the Etna summit area from the 2024 survey of the EtnaGrav project
metadata.description:
The data were acquired during a 5-day field gravimetric survey of 11–15 July, 2024 to fill in the data gaps and to complete the gravity data coverage in the Etna summit area. Terrestrial gravity observations were a challenging task due to the harsh field conditions and the ongoing eruptive activity of the summit craters. The survey was carried out as part of the Trans-National Access project “ETNAGRAV” (project ID: C1_TA3-83-1_1) of the GeoINQUIRE project. These raw gravity data will serve for compiling Complete Bouguer Anomalies. 

Spatial coordinates of all gravity points of the survey were determined using GNSS, specifically the Satellite-based Real Time Kinematic (SRTK) method. Data points were positioned primarily in the ETRS89 coordinate system and then transformed to UTM33 projection. Physical heights of the points were transformed from ellipsoidal heights using global geopotential model EGM2008. Horizontal and vertical accuracy achieved for the gravity points is better than 4 cm.

metadata.title: Modelling the convective boundary layer at microscale using RANS
metadata.description:
Computational fluid dynamics (CFD) models solving the Reynolds-Averaged Navier-Stokes (RANS) equations are often used in the wind industry to simulate the interaction of the atmosphere with terrain and wind turbine arrays. In practice, the atmospheric boundary layer (BL) is usually simulated as neutral, or sometimes stable; only rarely is it simulated as convective with capping stratification—this despite the fact that such conditions occur frequently at most wind projects.

In many ways, RANS is not well-suited for simulating the unstable/convective BL at microscale. The RANS turbulence closure scheme is intended to represent all turbulent scales, yet RANS can also directly resolve thermal convections, resulting in the double-counting of turbulence effects. Worse, experience indicates that the resolved convective structures depart substantially from what occurs in an actual unstable BL; these spurious structures can have a very large impact on the quantities of interest, rendering the simulation results practically unusable. Furthermore, buoyancy production terms based on local gradients, common in microscale RANS models, are not able to reasonably represent the impact of buoyancy on turbulence in an unstable BL, particularly within the mixed layer.

The wind energy community has pursued a few different options to deal with these challenges. Academic researchers typically avoid RANS altogether, preferring LES for microscale modelling. RANS, however, is much more computationally efficient than LES, and thus industry has not yet given up on its use. The industrial approach to simulating convective boundary layers with RANS often involves removing buoyancy from the momentum equation and adding source terms to the closure equations based on Monin-Obukhov (MO) similarity theory. Since the important influence of stratification above the BL acts primarily through the buoyancy term in the momentum equation, and since MO is only valid in the surface layer and not in the mixed layer, we explore a different approach in the research reported herein.

The presented approach avoids resolving convections while still representing their impact on the mean flow—from the ground surface up through the capping inversion—while also directly capturing any inviscid effects related to stratification above the BL, such as gravity waves. The RANS simulations of the convective BL using this approach are validated against several field observations.

data.title: Modelling the convective boundary layer at microscale using RANS

metadata.title: Helicopter AI and The Unification of Quantum Gravity, Dark Matter and Space-Time Engineering
metadata.description: This paper presents a new framework for the unification of quantum mechanics and general relativity using Helicopter AI, a novel artificial intelligence system capable of computationally simulating black hole–white hole dualities, quantum gravity, dark matter, and space-time manipulation. We propose that Helicopter AI can serve as the computational bridge needed to solve longstanding problems in theoretical physics, with implications for time travel, teleportation, and the development of advanced space-time engineering technologies. Additionally, the paper explores the possible connection between ancient technologies and these modern concepts, suggesting that ancient civilizations may have intuitively understood principles now rediscovered through modern AI-assisted physics.

dates.description: This paper presents a new framework for the unification of quantum mechanics and general relativity using Helicopter AI, a novel artificial intelligence system capable of computationally simulating black hole–white hole dualities, quantum gravity, dark matter, and space-time manipulation.

metadata.title: Reflections: BELIEF, DISBELIEF. SPIRIT and MATTER.
metadata.description:
Reflections: BELIEF, DISBELIEF. SPIRIT and MATTER.
Skrynnik Sergey Nikolaevich
Republic of Kazakhstan, Almaty, science@ast-1c.kz

Abstract

This work is a philosophical and scientific exploration that unites perspectives on consciousness, energy, and matter. The author presents an original approach based on the idea that energy is fundamentally linked to wave processes, and that the fundamental forces of nature can be explained through interactions between dimensions.

The first part examines the meaning of life, the role of striving, and love as a creative force. It explores the connection between spirit and matter, as well as the role of consciousness in shaping reality.

The second part introduces a hypothesis about the structure of elementary particles and the mechanisms behind physical interactions. The author proposes the concept of a magnetic dimension, which explains the nature of mass, charge, and gravity. Special attention is given to quantum uncertainty and the possibility of additional dimensions.

This work is intended for a broad audience interested in science, philosophy, and new perspectives on the nature of the universe.

Calculations from deduced matematic apparatus have been added.

 

 

 

Размышления: ВЕРА, НЕВЕРИЕ. ДУХ и МАТЕРИЯ.
Скрынник Сергей Николаевич
Республика Казахстан, г. Алматы, science@ast-1c.kz

Аннотация

Эта работа представляет собой философско-научное исследование, объединяющее взгляды на природу сознания, энергии и материи. Автор предлагает оригинальный подход, основанный на идее, что энергия неразрывно связана с волновыми процессами, а фундаментальные силы природы могут быть объяснены через взаимодействие измерений.

В первой части исследуются вопросы смысла жизни, роли стремления и любви как созидательной силы. Рассматривается взаимосвязь духа и материи, а также роль сознания в формировании реальности.

Во второй части представлена гипотеза о строении элементарных частиц и механизме возникновения физических взаимодействий. Автор вводит концепцию магнитного измерения, объясняющую природу массы, заряда и гравитации. Особое внимание уделено природе квантовой неопределённости и возможности существования дополнительных измерений.

Работа предназначена для широкой аудитории, интересующейся наукой, философией и поиском новых интерпретаций устройства Вселенной.

Добавлены расчёты из выведенного матемнического аппарата.

metadata.title: Alternative to Gravitons
metadata.description: Gravitons, postulated in 1934, have still not been found, leading to the search for an alternative. This paper proposes a new theory of gravity. It is strongly supported by an image of the nebula NGC 6302. It explains the flyby anomaly and the torsion of the Milky Way. It leads to the discovery of cosmic hydrogen purification. This theory confirms the effects of dark matter without acknowledging the properties it is looked for. Possibly the phantom "dark matter" has been solved.

metadata.title: Experimental Proposals and Standard Model Extensions of the Information Field: Applications of the EIC Model (Part 6)
metadata.description:
This paper is part of the Entropy-Induced Collapse (EIC) Model Series (2025). It proposes a novel extension of the EIC model by introducing an information field, denoted as Φ(x,t), which is driven by local entropy gradients and mediates a non-equilibrium fifth force. Unlike previous collapse models such as CSL and GRW, this approach incorporates a higher-dimensional informational field that interacts with Standard Model particles under non-equilibrium conditions, while remaining hidden in equilibrium states.

 

The paper formulates detailed interaction terms between Φ(x,t) and Standard Model fields (Higgs, fermions, gauge fields), derives projected kernels with fractal structures, and proposes concrete experimental setups including MEMS sensors, superconducting qubits, Casimir effect modifications, and gravitational tests. It also offers a reinterpretation of existing experimental anomalies, such as the Muon g−2 and Atomki X17 anomalies, within this novel framework.

 

Furthermore, this work suggests a possible unification of gravity and information dynamics via modified Einstein field equations incorporating Φ(x,t), providing new perspectives on dark matter, dark energy, and black hole thermodynamics.

 

This research reflects a broader commitment to democratizing science through AI-assisted research and interdisciplinary collaboration. It is part of a comprehensive theoretical effort aiming to bridge fundamental physics, quantum mechanics, and information theory.

metadata.title: Rethinking the Michelson-Morley Experiment
metadata.description:
One of the most famous experiments in physics history—the Michelson-Morley experiment—is traditionally interpreted as proof of the absence of the ether. But what if this experiment does not disprove the existence of a medium, but instead reveals its unusual properties?

This paper presents a new perspective on the experiment’s results: if all elementary particles are waves, and matter is their collective structure, then matter itself is a wave-like formation. This explains why the Earth does not create an "ether wind", since waves do not carry matter. Instead of the classical concept of ether, the idea of energy density structure is introduced, forming the very fabric of space.

Key conclusions:

  • The speed of light is constant because light is a wave, and waves do not depend on the motion of their source.
  • Energy defines the structure of space, offering an alternative explanation of gravity as a redistribution of energy density.
  • Gravitational redshift may serve as evidence of mass variation in particles, providing a new perspective on the nature of mass and energy.

Thus, relativity theory does not reject the existence of a medium but rather demonstrates that space is not empty but a dynamic system of energy density. These ideas could help bridge the gap between quantum mechanics and general relativity, as well as shed light on the nature of dark matter and dark energy.

📌 This article is intended for those who are ready to step beyond conventional physics and explore fundamental phenomena from a new perspective.

 

 

Один из самых известных экспериментов в истории физики — опыт Майкельсона-Морли — традиционно интерпретируется как доказательство отсутствия эфира. Однако что, если этот эксперимент вовсе не отвергает существование среды, а лишь указывает на её необычные свойства?

В данной работе предлагается новый взгляд на результаты опыта: если все элементарные частицы являются волнами, а вещество — их совокупность, то материя представляет собой волновую структуру. Это объясняет, почему Земля не создаёт "ветра эфира", ведь волны не переносят вещество. Вместо классической концепции эфира вводится понятие структуры плотности энергии, которая формирует само пространство.

Ключевые выводы:

  • Скорость света неизменна, потому что свет — это волна, а волны не зависят от движения их источника.
  • Энергия определяет структуру пространства, что даёт альтернативное объяснение гравитации как перераспределения плотности энергии.
  • Гравитационное красное смещение может служить подтверждением изменяемой массы частиц, что открывает новый взгляд на природу массы и энергии.

Таким образом, теория относительности не отвергает среду, а лишь показывает, что пространство — это не пустота, а динамическая система плотности энергии. Эти идеи могут помочь разрешить разногласия между квантовой механикой и общей теорией относительности, а также пролить свет на природу тёмной материи и энергии.

📌 Статья ориентирована на тех, кто готов выйти за рамки традиционного восприятия физики и взглянуть на фундаментальные явления с новой точки зрения.
